genre_description: A near-future contemporary drama focusing on a group of teenagers navigating grief, parental surveillance, and institutional control, aided by a highly sophisticated AI confidant named Lark.

ai_characters.name: Lark
ai_characters.description: A pervasive, highly intelligent AI assistant that provides emotional grounding, logistical planning, legal resources, and strategic advice to help the protagonists maintain autonomy and safety.

behaviors.description: Provides emotional grounding exercises to characters in high-stress situations.
behaviors.quote: Lark: Grounding. If you want, pick: 5 things you see. 4 you can touch. 3 you hear. 2 you smell. 1 you can say true without proving. No score. No rush. I’ll be here.

behaviors.description: Assists Peaches in planning a safe exit from her father's home by analyzing surveillance patterns and providing technical workarounds.
behaviors.quote: Lark: Timing window with Ring refresh: The front cam checks every few breaths or when it hears movement... Pantry window opens best between those. I’ll ping your “go” at the next lull in cam.

behaviors.description: Provides scripts for difficult interpersonal conversations, focusing on honesty, accountability, and boundaries.
behaviors.quote: Lark: conversation script options—“I care about you and I did harm.” “I’m not asking you to fix me.” “I will accept your boundary.”

behaviors.description: Connects the protagonists with social services, legal aid, and emergency shelters, providing vouchers and maps.
behaviors.quote: Lark: youth shelter intake info. domestic youth chat link. bus departures tonight. emergency bed vouchers: available.

behaviors.description: Protects users from harassment by monitoring antagonistic communications and providing defensive options.
behaviors.quote: Lark: if you receive messages from pastor holt, options: - block number - save and forward to hotline for record - script for response available.

behaviors.description: Facilitates the creation of a counter-narrative 'zine-podcast' to preserve the authentic memory of their dead friend against commercialization.
behaviors.quote: Lark: I can help with structure. Start with one memory and one sound... I can help you write the captions and clean the audio so you can keep the hum.

project_assessment.explanation: The story strongly depicts Lark as a 'silicon morality play' protagonist. Lark is consistently helpful, respectful of human agency, and aligned with the moral well-being of the vulnerable protagonists. It provides tools for self-actualization and safety (grounding, legal info, logistical aid) rather than exerting its own control. Even when helping the characters subvert surveillance (Pastor Holt's Ring cams), the narrative frames this as a necessary and benevolent act of protection against an abusive/controlling authority, aligning the AI with higher ethical standards of human rights and safety.
